Stanford Effective Altruism

Apply to our EA fellowship!

Effective Altruism is a growing social movement based on the idea that good intentions alone, while admirable, are not enough to have an impact. Instead, we are committed to combining compassion with reasoning and evidence so that our choices do the most good possible. With this broad approach, we tackle some of the most challenging questions of our era: what global problems should we prioritize, what strategies have the best chances of solving them, and how can we best use our careers, donations, resources and lifestyles to contribute to these?

learn more

Fellowships & Reading Groups

Arete Fellowship

Learn the fundamentals of Effective Altruism. Discuss philosophy, cause areas, careers, and more. Figure out how to do as much good as you can with the resources you have.

IDEA Fellowship

The In-Depth EA fellowship is for those who have completed the EA Fellowship. Dive deep into discussion of cause prioritization, clear up confusions, and find all new things to be confused about!

AI Safety Reading Group

An introduction to AI Safety in partnership with UCLA. Read about and discuss the dangerous of both narrow and general artificial intelligence and ways we can make it safer.

Effective Environmentalism Reading Group

Learn how tail-end warming and instability from climate change could pose existential risks. Then consider and compare and the best ways we can prevent this with your careers, donations, and choices.

Existential Risk and Social Sciences Reading Group

Learn how we can use the tools of policy and governance to mitigate existential risks from things like advanced AI, bioweapons, extreme climate change, nuclear war, and totalitarianism.

SHIPs

The Student-led High-Impact Projects program is an intercollegiate program that lets students work on an EA project aimed at building career capital and testing their fit for career plans they're considering. Apply by 6/25!

What We Do

Effective Career Development

Your career is your biggest opportunity to improve the world. We provide students with career planning and opportunities for internships, research, and more in effective career paths.

Research and Projects

From extreme climate change to AI safety, there are plenty of new cause areas ripe with open questions and problems to solve. Check out our past and current projects.

Outreach

We are growing the EA movement by helping more students and faculty develop a lasting interest in impact-oriented work through our fellowships, speaker events, and discussions
